body_html:
Thanks @skye That solved the error. I had tried this before but had called loss and backdrop as methods :). I overlooked the fact that they are just attributes.
Now the output shapes are not matching. I am trying to fix that. The error messages are quite hard to interpret.

[ RUN      ] NNGradTest.SoftmaxCrossEntropyWithLogitsGrad
tensorflow/cc/gradients/nn_grad_test.cc:55: Failure
      Expected: ::tensorflow::Status::OK()
      Which is: OK
To be equal to: ((ComputeGradientError<float, float, float>( scope_, xs, x_shapes, ys, y_shapes, &max_error)))
      Which is: Invalid argument: Dimensions must be equal, but are 3 and 5 for 'MatMul' (op: 'MatMul') with input shapes: [5,3], [5,3].

So clearly one of the matrices need to be of shape [3,5] but which one. So I am just trying all combinations in the inputs and outputs.

body:
Thanks @skye That solved the error. I had tried this before but had called loss and backdrop as methods :). I overlooked the fact that they are just attributes.  
Now the output shapes are not matching. I am trying to fix that. The error messages are quite hard to interpret.
```
[ RUN      ] NNGradTest.SoftmaxCrossEntropyWithLogitsGrad
tensorflow/cc/gradients/nn_grad_test.cc:55: Failure
      Expected: ::tensorflow::Status::OK()
      Which is: OK
To be equal to: ((ComputeGradientError<float, float, float>( scope_, xs, x_shapes, ys, y_shapes, &max_error)))
      Which is: Invalid argument: Dimensions must be equal, but are 3 and 5 for 'MatMul' (op: 'MatMul') with input shapes: [5,3], [5,3].
```
So clearly one of the matrices need to be of shape [3,5] but which one. So I am just trying all combinations  in the inputs and outputs.
